column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Kolga (Estonia): At the outset, allow me to\r
#Text=join others in expressing gratitude to the Secretary-\r
#Text=General, the Executive Director of UN Women,\r
#Text=the High Commissioner for Human Rights and the\r
#Text=representative of the Non-governmental Organization\r
#Text=Working Group on Women, Peace and Security for\r
#Text=their statements.
#Text=I would also like to thank the Council\r
#Text=presidency for taking up the topic and organizing the\r
#Text=open debate today.
#Text=Estonia aligns itself with the statement of the\r
#Text=European Union delivered earlier.
#Text=In addition, I would\r
#Text=like to make the following remarks.
#Text=Estonia is dedicated to protecting and promoting\r
#Text=human rights and fundamental freedoms, both\r
#Text=nationally and internationally.
#Text=As a member of the\r
#Text=Human Rights Council, our particular focus is on the\r
#Text=rights of women and children, gender perspective in\r
#Text=conflict settlements and the fight against impunity.
#Text=Estonia firmly believes that the rule of law in conflict\r
#Text=and post-conflict situations must promote justice and\r
#Text=accountability in ways that further the rights of women,\r
#Text=including through legal and institutional reforms that\r
#Text=are gender sensitive.
#Text=The equal right to decision-making\r
#Text=and participation, along with women's empowerment,\r
#Text=is crucial to ensure a functioning society and peace and\r
#Text=justice in the aftermath of conflicts.
#Text=Additionally, as stated in the Secretary-General's\r
#Text=report (S/2013/525), women's representation in the\r
#Text=justice sector plays a significant role in increasing the\r
#Text=reporting of crimes and enhancing public trust in the\r
#Text=rule of law institutions.
#Text=The importance of prevention\r
#Text=must likewise be stressed.
#Text=By enabling women to fully\r
#Text=participate in judicial systems, we can better tackle the\r
#Text=root causes of impunity for Violence against women.
#Text=Estonia welcomes the call by the Security Council\r
#Text=in today's resolution to Member States to comply\r
#Text=with their relevant obligations to end impunity and\r
#Text=to thoroughly investigate and prosecute persons\r
#Text=responsible for atrocity crimes.
#Text=Estonia further agrees\r
#Text=with the Council that the fight against impunity for the\r
#Text=most serious crimes of international concern against\r
#Text=women and girls has been strengthened through the\r
#Text=work of the International Criminal Court (ICC),\r
#Text=the ad hoc and mixed tribunals, and the specialized\r
#Text=chambers in national tribunals.
#Text=ICC prosecutions\r
#Text=will not, however, be sufficient to ensure complete\r
#Text=accountability.
#Text=Therefore, it is essential that the gender\r
#Text=provisions of the Rome Statute are translated into\r
#Text=national prosecutions.
#Text=Justice for victims of atrocity crimes, however,\r
#Text=entails more thanjust punishing perpetrators.
#Text=The Rome\r
#Text=Statute further empowers victims by its broad victim-\r
#Text=participation scheme and underlines its commitment to\r
#Text=victims by its reparations provisions.
#Text=Likewise, the ICC\r
#Text=Trust Fund for Victims has been doing important work\r
#Text=to alleviate the suffering of Victims in the countries\r
#Text=where the Court is conducting investigations.
#Text=Estonia was honoured to join the Declaration\r
#Text=of Commitment to End Sexual Violence in Conflict\r
#Text=during the General Assembly's opening week.
#Text=We were\r
#Text=also glad to see how much interest there was in the\r
#Text=topic of enhancing accountability for sexual violence\r
#Text=in conflict, discussed at a side event during that week\r
#Text=that focused on the role of the ICC and that was hosted\r
#Text=by the Estonian Mission to the United Nations.
#Text=We\r
#Text=would like to commend the important work of the Team\r
#Text=of Experts on Rule of Law and Sexual Violence in\r
#Text=Conflict, and I am glad to note that Estonia has made\r
#Text=financial contributions to the activities of the Team.
#Text=Estonia would also like to take the opportunity\r
#Text=to emphasize that in addition to conflict-related\r
#Text=sexual violence, increased attention should be paid\r
#Text=to the full range of violations and serious crimes\r
#Text=experienced by women, including gendered impacts\r
#Text=of enforced disappearances, foreign occupation, mass\r
#Text=forced displacement, restrictions on humanitarian\r
#Text=aid, conflict-related trafficking and the destruction of\r
#Text=civilian infrastructure.
#Text=Let me also commend UN Women for their work\r
#Text=targeted at raising the number of national action plans\r
#Text=related to resolution 1325 (2000) or other relevant\r
#Text=planning instruments, as outlined in the recently\r
#Text=adopted UN Women Strategic Plan.
#Text=Estonia developed\r
#Text=its national action plan in 2010 and has advised a number\r
#Text=of States on developing theirs.
#Text=We would be ready to\r
#Text=cooperate in that regard with other States in the future.
#Text=We are looking forward to hearing the results of the\r
#Text=global study, and to the high-level review in 2015.
#Text=In conclusion, we are glad to note that Estonia was\r
#Text=among the sponsors of resolution 2106 (2013), which\r
#Text=strengthens the monitoring and prevention of sexual\r
#Text=violence in conflict, and we were happy to co-sponsor\r
#Text=resolution 2122 (2013), adopted today.
